turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about 1987 Daxing'anling Wildfire.
turn.1: What were the major effects of the 1987 Daxing'anling Wildfire?
turn.2: Workers reported their truck engines stopping as the fire deprived the oxygen supply in the air as well as burning projectiles raining down on them ahead of the fire.
turn.4: A total of 191 people were killed by the fire, and a further 250 were left injured.
turn.6: In addition, 33,000 Chinese were made homeless.
turn.8: Although both countries were affected heavily by the fire, China and the Soviet Union responded very differently.
turn.10: China, despite its shortage of advanced firefighting equipment, sent over 60,000 soldiers and workers to try and put out the fire.
turn.11: Why were they trying to put out the fire?
turn.12: Because the forest was a major source of wood for China as well as the fact that it was close to the Gobi desert and thus a factor in desertification in northern China, China spent much effort on extinguishing the flames.
